website_summaries.verdict: A briefcase designed to handle the world of business travel on a budget.
pros: Designed to preserve one's laptop first and foremost
Features many compartments for smaller items
cons: Material is what you'd expect for the price

customer_reviews.title: I like the Amazon bag for multiple reasons
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a worn out Samsonite rolling computer bag (retailed for $200-300) with this Amazon Basics rolling computer bag. The Amazon bag functions at least as well, and perhaps a bit better. I like the Amazon bag for multiple reasons: 1. Sufficient capacity for my Dell Latitude with a 15.6" display screen and a huge number of it's accessories (portfolio binder, pens, business cards, small AC adapter, mouse, external keyboard (mini), Wi-Fi range extender, Ethernet cable, presentation tool, cable lock, ...), a n inch or two stack of documents, umbrella , flashlight, etc. 2. Lightweight 3. Smaller outside than the Samsonite, but seems to have just as much capacity 4. Wheels are very quiet when rolling 5 Quality 6. Price
customer_reviews.author: arecf

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY-Wheels Wear Off and CANNOT be replaced!
customer_reviews.text: The wheels for this bag DO NOT LAST! 5 months and this bag is SHOT! They cannot be replaced and just rolling around town for 5 month wears them down to the core. The plastic wheel wears and then RIPS right off. Especially as an Amazon product this should not happen! SO: now I have a wheel bag with dead wheels; the bag is great but now unusable. Do not buy unless your wheeling around once a week on perfect indoor surfaces (which of course is NOT the point of a business wheeled case)
customer_reviews.author: BJR-NYC-Print

customer_reviews.title: The wheel warn out in about 6 months. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: It has been about 6 months and one of the wheels is so warn out that it wont spin. The other wheel does good but with one wheel spinning it will ruin the bag. I am very disappointed in this bag and wont get a "amazon basic" product again!
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Misadvertised product
customer_reviews.text: This case seems to be reasonable sturdy and has a lot of room and pockets. However, It was advertised as accommodating up to a 17 inch monitor and II wanted it for a 17 inch HP laptop. My laptop would not fit into the laptop pocket at all. I was very disappointed that it was advertised for use for 17 inch monitors when there is no way any 17 inch monitor would fit.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Money best spent on something better made
customer_reviews.text: This product is a perfect example of how review can greatly mislead a buyer. Can’t for the life of me see how it has a good rating. I’ve not had it very long and already it is completely useless and destroyed. I’m a field service engineer for multifunction automated office equipment and light production print engines so I can confidently say it is poorly made. Within the first week I had need to repair the handle. The tires have actually worn completely off now. Zipper shot. Bottom line. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ostrander

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight case
customer_reviews.text: This case is lightweight and it travels easily. It's got plenty of room to hold all you need. It probably can hold much more than it should, however, for its strength. In other words, if you pack it full and cart it around a lot, you'll probably shorten its lifespan, but if you treat it with reasonable care - and not use it to pack all your heavy school books along with all your computer accessories, for example - it should hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Already breaking after less than 2months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in mid October.. it's December 1st (so like 1.5 months) and one of the wheels looks 3/4s dead and the bottom is starting to rip off. Do Not Buy, this product will leave you disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet my needs
customer_reviews.text: When you get a bag that roles, you need to wheels to be strong. These wheels are made with 2 pieces put together and rubber coating over the top. They look great for maybe a month, until that rubber coating wears off and you are left with the 2 pieces coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Handle fell apart after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I know I use the bags in a heavy duty way, and the first one lasted a year before the zippers broke so I bought #2. The second one lasted a few weeks before the handle started falling apart. I kept on screwing the handle screws in and they kept on falling out and then the attachment to the bag started breaking as well...crazy junk. No where near the quality of the first one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Becker

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Bag
customer_reviews.text: Well made, quality rolling work bag. It holds my computer as well as files and mu lunch! The only complaints have to do with the design: 1) the rear handle drags on the ground when pulled by the telescopic handle (just tuck it into the handle), and 2) the inner sections are not completely separate (this allows unruly papers to slide down and sag at the bottom of the bag). These are both very minor, and overall I am very pleased! It is a nice, sturdy bag with quality materials, stitching, computer padding, and structural support.
customer_reviews.author: Chrislyn

customer_reviews.title: After only using this bag for one year, one ...
customer_reviews.text: After only using this bag for one year, one of the wheels completely fell apart and can't be fixed. The price was decent but I expected it to last more than one year.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my wife and her frequent travels a year or two ago. It holds her laptop and important papers well. It’s ridden through airports across the country and to work locally every day. It starting to show signs of use , but it’s still kicking. Happy with it for sure. I’m sure there are even tougher models out there but you’d pay that premium. For the price this is and has served us well. Update November 2020- She has this thing overstuffed and carries it literally every day of the work week (and some weekends) and it’s still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Slug Jones

customer_reviews.title: I use this case every day and wonder why I ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this case every day and wonder why I waited so long to buy it. It is light weight but durable, holds my old heavy laptop securely along with whatever items I need to carry along. I generally have it stuffed during the day with charts, files and reports, and use it at night to carry home my coat and lunch box as well as the computer. The handle length is long, and while it does not seem to have size adjustments, the length works well for me and my taller colleagues if they happen to help out. So far, it has been scuff resistant and keeps it's professional look.
customer_reviews.author: Thunter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new bag for conferences and wanted one that could accommodate more than just my laptop and a few papers. I was looking for a nice leather bag and spent forever reading reviews. After feeling like nothing was quite right I gave up and bought this thinking it would be my "just for now" bag while I kept looking. But this bag is fantastic! It fits so much stuff. The pockets are perfect for my needs. I've traveled abroad with it and drug it around at many conferences over the last year. It is incredibly sturdy and durable. The wheels roll so nicely. I don't have a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Amberly

customer_reviews.title: this will probably be just fine. But if you are a commuter like I ...
customer_reviews.text: Precisely 4 months and it already needs replacing. I am a commuter; I am in the office everyday, and it takes 2 buses and a train to get me there. As of this review, my 4 month old bag has the bottom seam ripping out, and the bag droops in the center which has caused the inside of the wheels to be worn disproportionately more than the outside of the wheels. If you just need a bag to roll from door to car and car to door, this will probably be just fine. But if you are a commuter like I am, or you tend to move the bag around a lot you will definitely need a sturdier bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Computer Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is the lightest and smallest bag in its class. The Amazon folks figured out exactly what a traveling business person needs to carry and designed a bag to meet those needs. First the bag has to be easily wheeled thru plane isles and be easy lifted into overhead compartments or be placed under the seat in front. This bag meets this better than any bag. Then the bag has to fit up to a large laptop with extra space for files in one compartment. And in the other compartment, one could put other electronics like a projector and mic system or clothes for day trip. This bag meets this.
customer_reviews.author: EdS

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is cheap. He won't buy anything new unless the old one is falling apart. But his old computer bag was in sad shape. I thought this was affordable enough he would be OK with me spending the money. Well, he is crazy happy I did! And he can't believe that this is all I spent! It's easy to use, light weight, easy to carry (not that you carry it often with the wheels.) His last computer bag was large and heavy. This is streamlined and lightweight. He fit everything from the old bag! He is very happy with the purchase! Therefore so am I!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommygadgets

customer_reviews.title: A bargain for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with my purchase. The bag is sturdy and roomy so I have been able to put quite a lot of books and files in it without any issues. I am 5' 11'' and the bag feels very comfortable to pull with the extended handle. The bag rolls smoothly and the wheels seem very sturdy. After reading some of the negative reviews I made sure I got the protection plan just in case. I had been lugging heavy bags to work and knew I needed a bag like this, but they were so expensive. This one was at a great price point considering what the competition goes for.
customer_reviews.author: Kim McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fair value. I looked at a number of the roller brief cases in the $50 to $100 range. This will get the job done. But, it feels ever so smaller, doesn't have quite the number of features as some of the others. Zippers are a little lighter duty. I'm going to keep it and it is just large enough. I'd spend more on a nicer bag, if you are going to over pack it with heavy books or gadgets, if you are the type that jumps curbs, or will lift it by the telescoping handle.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Not good as a daily commuter bag.
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is fine. But after one month of use, one of the wheels broke. Due to construction design, it cannot be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: BorJ

customer_reviews.title: Bulky for Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: This laptop cart was purchased for my daily use at work as I have to transfer a few files to different locations with my laptop, projector, and a binder. Prior to purchasing this item I used a collapsible plastic bin on wheels. This was a huge improvement on style and maneuverability, but unfortunately I am not able to transport everything I once had. I am confident this product will last several years even with my rough wear and tear up and down stairs and through parking lots. It should also be mentioned that it is cumbersome to carry once loaded.
customer_reviews.author: VB mom

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy and long lasting bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag almost 2 and a half years ago. Since then, I've used it almost daily to bring my laptop to and from work. This bag has been dragged through puddles and sometimes snow but still works great and protects my laptop. I like the compartments and pockets. I will be retiring in 6 months and I'm confident this bag will last beyond that date. It is a heavy bag and does need to be carried in more than a couple inches of snow, but otherwise it is a great bag and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something cuter. I know, silly goal. I also wanted a water bottle holder and a sleeve to mount this on top of a larger suitcase. I got none of those 3 things. However, I am still delighted by this case! It holds my larger laptop(15.6 inches wide), a change of clothes, and everything I normally have in my purse. It fit great in the overhead bin. I would NOT want this by my feet on a plane. The zippers work smoothly. The handle is sturdy enough. Especially for the price, this is a really great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: The bottom of the bad started to drop in a week and hit the ...
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the bad started to drop in a week and hit the ground as I was rolling it. The frame is poorly designed. I am glad I was within return window.
customer_reviews.author: NNO

customer_reviews.title: While I enjoy the spaciousness and extendable handle
customer_reviews.text: While I enjoy the spaciousness and extendable handle, there are a few gripes. - Small item management is horrible. Anytime you store something in the limited storage pockets, they fall out the minute your bag is not upright, like in an overhead bin. Pens, business cards, USB drives, etc, just lying in the front pocket. - The main laptop compartment has a divider, but it doesn't go all the way to the bottom, meaning your items will be sliding all over the place. I guess I got what I paid for
customer_reviews.author: Jay McGlinsey

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the same size case I had before!
customer_reviews.text: Love this case! Many people at work recommended it to me. Since I had one the same size from a different company with one compartment as the main compartment with an opening that did not allow easy and full access for files, etc., I hesitated to buy this one when I could "make do" with the one I had. I am SO glad that I finally ordered this! It fully opens across the top and the sections are large enough to keep whatever is put in them separated. I carry many types of things in it, including my lunch (then the food goes into the refrigerator at work).
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag - LOVE IT <3
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work constantly so I needed a bag for my work laptop. This bag is an amazing deal! This is my second time buying it. It fits a lot and works great. The wheels are smooth and durable. The material is great. I've been rained on a few times and it protected my laptop. The zippers work smoothly as well. The only reason I had to replace the first one was because my Uber driver got into an accident and the bag flew and hit the seat so the handle broke. But, I loved it so much I had to buy another one. I highly recommend it. Thank you Amazon! :)
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, affordable bag
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the least expensive rolling laptop bags available and I'm very happy with it. It holds my work laptop (15.6 screen) plus my headset and still has room for plenty of other things if needed. The padding for the laptop is nice and it is held in place. There have been complaints about the wheels falling apart after use. I can't speak to that yet, but I do try to be careful with it and not roll it too much on really bad pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for price, more room than expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a temporary solution when my wife hurt her back and couldn’t carry her laptop and supplies in to work. But it ended up so unexpectedly perfect as a carry on for airline travel. Roomier than I would’ve thought and easy to maneuver. Lightweight but rugged. For the price a great purchase. Better only if it had spinner wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Coghan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad..
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag. It's pretty sturdy and rolls well. It's made well and is a great bag. The only problem is I have three Teacher's Edition books to carry and they don't all fit in this bag, width wise. They aren't huge, maybe the size of three college textbooks so I was a little disappointed they didn't all fit. I can fit two in there and my laptop so I'm happy. Would have given five stars if it was a little wider for all my books though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this bag to carry my work related files to and from my job sites for the last 8 months. It has worked as I expected. It holds a lot in its compartments. It’s nice to be able to wheel my stuff around instead of carrying it. It has held up fantastically without any signs of wear and tear and I haven’t been exactly gentle with it. And the price was right! I’ve been very happy with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: ASArizona

customer_reviews.title: Great for the $$
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic rolling case. It does the job well. I used it for work, I'm a traveling school therapist so I go between 3-4 schools a day, packing tons of binders, papers, laptop, and other junk in here. It held up great for a year and a half, but by the end of a second tough Wisconsin winter, it was shot. Wheels broke off, bottom tore out. I will order another because you can't beat the price and the quality is good. I really wouldn't expect any higher priced version to do better in the salt, ice, and snow we've had.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a rolling laptop case that would fit my 17" HP laptop to use as a carry on for flying. Also wanted it to fit under the seat so I didn't have to store it in the overhead bin. So far I have used it for three flights, on three different airlines, and it stored perfectly under all three seats. Even with my large laptop inside, there is still plenty of room left to use for books etc. It is a simple, lightweight, nice looking bag for a great price. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kit c

customer_reviews.title: Such a great work case!!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great laptop and work case to take around with you. Really well designed and thought out , it works perfectly and cuts down my lugging 2 or 3 bags. Lots of pockets for extra things and your phone . Plenty of room and I take a lot around with me. I still have room left which is amazing. I work moving around and it has made things so much easier. Just need to see now how it bears up after some months of use. So far , very good. 9/18/18 Still going great since I bought this. Never missed a beat or any faults with it. I use it daily and give it some tough treatment.
customer_reviews.author: louloubell

customer_reviews.title: Nice Small Garment Bag
customer_reviews.text: Its a small carry on garment bag. If you take a very large size it may not work for you, but being average build myself it is great. You can avoid some of the wrinkle complaints that people have by packing your suits while they still have the dry clean plastic on them. Overall it's great for bringing a couple of average size suits in a carry on size bag. I can also fit some shirts ties and even a pair of shoes in the bag. Can't complain much about it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dulski

customer_reviews.title: Kind of big and boring
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for post cardic surgery when I could not lift more than 10 pounds. Works well for a roller bag and was inexpensive for my short term use. Would definately not recommend it for long term use. Kind of big and clunky with compartments oddly largely sized. I think if you need a roller bag for long term use, such as back problem, spend more to get a better designed bag. If you want to use for short term (e.g. 3 months), like me, then get it, use it short term, and throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for sure. I’m not in need of super flashy, fashionable bags when it comes to hauling my computer and paperwork. This bag is nice. The hand pulley slides in and out easily and the handles are strong for lifting into my trunk. I’m hooked on rolling my stuff now. I’m basically a pack mule and this is saving my back. I’m going to take this on trips too. Not just for computers. Easily works for men and women.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the screws that hold the bar you pull kept coming out and eventually two were lost, and this morning the third came out so I have to order an entire new bag. I carry a screwdriver with me and tighten the screws often and they still managed to get loose and fall out. Won't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Mff8579

customer_reviews.title: Not practical, the telescopic handle is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: In order to use the handle, a cover drags in the back of the case (for everyone to see) or you have to stuff and wrinkle it inside. The zippered compartment remains open in order to use the telescoping handle. It's awful and not practical. The case looks good. Just a look at the handle and wheels and it went back. I am not a picky customer; after years of buying in Amazon, this is the second time I return an article.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great Rolly Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolly bag! I can't wear shoulder bags comfortably any longer, so this bag is a relief. I can haul my laptop, mp3 player, laptop charger, tablet and external drive in the "laptop" compartment. The padded pouch fits my 15.6 laptop perfectly. When I want to carry my 17.3 laptop instead, I use the area just outside the padding. The front pocket holds android and apple chargers and office supplies. The rear compartment is where I keep a few files. I am 5'8" and I find the telescoping handle just a tad too tall, but not unweildy. The handles make it easy to maneuver this bag on stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie H.

customer_reviews.title: So far, this bag is great!
customer_reviews.text: 2/28/20 - I received this bag this week. I love the telescoping handle and how it locks into place for my height and easy pulling. The wheels seem to glide very well. There is a lot of room for my laptop, files, etc. I only use this bag for commuting to/from the office. I didn't expect great quality for a less than $50 bag but I have to say, it has exceeded my expectations. If my opinion changes, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned that buying such an inexpensive rolling laptop computer case would be a mistake. I thought it would likely be cheapy and not last. Nevertheless, I purchased it anyway and boy have I been pleasantly surprised! It has been used shuttling heavy text books and my laptop between home and classes plus I also use it when I travel as my carry-on bag. I pack it to the gills and it keeps rolling along.... still looks great, remains sturdy and is in great condition after almost a year!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bag
customer_reviews.text: Needed a nice rolling bag for work travel. Haven't used it yet, but it should meet my needs well. My only complaints are that it does not have a strap to secure it to a larger piece of luggage or an optional shoulder strap. I primarily will be rolling this bag, but I do see times when it might be necessary to carry it. Would be nice for a bag to come designed for all situations. I'll have to rig up something so that I can handle all of my bags when travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice laptop case
customer_reviews.text: This thing is been put through the ringer. It seems sturdy and holds up very well. You're not going to put 250 pounds in the unit. Or use the handle as a swing. But for the purpose it's meant for it has done excellent.
customer_reviews.author: William Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Rolling Laptop Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag since I am now that I am working mostly from home with lots of paperwork going back and forth to and from the office. I like that there is a padded pouch for the laptop. There is plenty of storage space for all the files. The only thing I was concerned about when I got it was the expanding handle. It feels a bit flimsy but so far I haven't had any issues. I don't use that handle to lift with so all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Paula J

customer_reviews.title: Disposable rolling bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to save my back and shoulders from regular cases. After researching B&R and TUMI bags, this one is gives me 98% of what those bags do and I can purchase a new one, every year for the next 20 years, and still come out ahead. The interior organization isn't perfect, but for the price and for the 'save the body while running through airports', this is working out great.
customer_reviews.author: PALong

customer_reviews.title: Great case ... but not under the seat.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great. It has all the pockets and features that I wanted and protected my laptop nicely. It fit perfectly under the airline seat on my first trip ... but on return trip it would not fit. So it went into the overhead and I didn't have the access to all my "stuff" that I was counting on. So, it's a great case. It would serve well for many uses. But if you are intent on having an under-the-seat carry-on bag for every flight, I'd look for a smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuelle Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great deal good job amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. I ordered a samsonsite bag for women’s laptop and it was nicer in terms of the interior fabric and padding for laptop areas but this amazon basics bag has a better handle for carrying. It’s taller and I’m short, so for people 5’6 and taller it’s definitely ideal. I can fit a 3” binder, my laptop, and plenty of very thick graduate coursework books in. I wish there was more pockets in the between layers but overall it’s really big.
customer_reviews.author: JaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight bag
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my computer recently, and bought this bag to haul it around. Nice padded pocket in front for computer, and no tipping due to the weight up front.- which was a problem with my last bag. Great for the money if it holds up. I use everyday, so will report back if it does not last a year - which is my expectation for this case.
customer_reviews.author: gentry

customer_reviews.title: Screws on the hande came off!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to write a positive review but decided to wait. I haven't traveled through any airports or on any long distance trips. I go from my house to my clinic. I am very careful with all of my items. I have a towel in my car, to ensure I don't scratch my car seats up and only roll the briefcase from the house to car, car to clinic, and vice versa. I noticed that there were 2 screw near the top handle that had come completely unscrewed and fell off! I had to go through my tool box to find something that would fit. There is no option to contact seller to inform them of this flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Advanced H.

customer_reviews.title: Suited my needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that I strap a backpack on and take all over at a Role Playing convention. this worked out so well and everyone was telling me it was a great idea. It had a perfect width, is easily ticked against a wall. and with the right backpack (that has a back pad) you will not need to carry anything. I was amazed that everything fit in it and no one got tripped up in a crowded area
customer_reviews.author: GMBarry

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight case!
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight case! Perfect sized for a laptop up to 17". Nice wide compartment for laptop padded on one side and with a wide Velcro nylon strap. The front pocket has many pockets within. Handle so far works great but is on the loose side for going up and down so I hope constantly moving it up and down does not strip the little pieces that catch to hold it in position. The quality if the fabric is very good. Wheels are sturdy, make minimal noise on tile but you can hear them rolling. For the price it was definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: piper

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, not usable for me.
customer_reviews.text: The wheels work great, the compartments are smart and work very well, but the structure/frame could be stronger-- I carry my laptop and quite a few files, and the bottom closest to the pull-up handle is bent and touched the ground as I pull the bag. Was recommended by Amazon so thought the quality would be better than this.
customer_reviews.author: rkdoulou

customer_reviews.title: Great value and design
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many reviews about so many bags, I'm so glad I found this bag, and it was the lowest priced bag. For the price, it is an excellent purchase. The bag rolls well. The two compartments are good for separating my textbooks (I'm a high school teacher) from my laptop/ipad. The exterior pocket is nice for storing miscellaneous supplies like pens, id cards, etc. I like how the handle is sturdy too for when I need to retract the long pulling handle to lift the bag up my long flight of stairs at school. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina L.

customer_reviews.title: In it for the long haul!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag for over two years and it has held up beautifully. All parts are still fully functional, and I really abuse this thing (dragged up and down a few steps, throwing into my trunk daily, jamming full w/ files & such, etc.). Definitely worth it for the price - no need to spend more on a fancy name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A surprisingly sturdy, well-designed rolling bag , especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This bag costs considerably less than many of the bags I've had before--- I use them to carry vast quantities of music for my classes and seminars on a daily basis. Despite its low price, this new bag is balanced, sturdy, and strategically designed, with a far more reliable retracting handle mechanism than the others. I cannot recommend this bag enough, and plan to buy another soon as a back-up.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Zark

customer_reviews.title: Wheels wear out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've had this case for about two months, walking to and from work five days a week, for a total of about 80 miles over the time I've had it. Both of the plastic wheels are almost worn out, and there doesn't seem to be a way to replace them. Needless to say, I wouldn't buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Neuendorf

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hospital visits. Able to hold papers in files in the large compartment. Back compartment holds water bottle and snacks. Used the smaller front compartment for pens, ear pods, chargers and cords. Also a few bottles of meds. I even use the handle to hold my purse when walking with the case. Purse sits on top of case and handles wrap around the lifted handle.
customer_reviews.author: Doxiemama01

customer_reviews.title: for the price it'd have to be pretty awful to rate poorly
customer_reviews.text: Look, for the price it'd have to be pretty awful to rate poorly, but this is actually quite nice. Basic, simple, nothing blingy about it, it does all the basic roling-briefcase business and - so far - appears well constructed and highly functional. As a long human, I still always wish these things had an extra 'joint' to extend the handle for someone over 5'9" (I mean, shorter people still use it long, right?!) but aside from that typical feature, I'm very pleased with the item and its price.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great rolling briefcase
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted! I use it to carry my files etc. back & forth to work. It isn't like a suitcase and has pockets for all my little things. I've been using it for several months & I've had no problems with either the construction or wheels,
customer_reviews.author: S. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great for work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great briefcase/laptop carrier for work. If you have lots of materials, books, folders and/or a laptop to transport on a daily basis or just a few times a week, this makes toting easier; takes pressure off shoulders, back and arms. The telescopic handle feels a little light and shaky, but so far, no complaints. Very happy with the product and the price!
customer_reviews.author: Elllie Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag For Work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend who just graduated nursing school ( I told her when she passed the NClEX I would buy her a nursing bag) but she got lucky and landed the DON position at the nursing home I work at. She no longer just needed a nursing bag but something that would hold a lot of binders and paperwork. This little bag has been perfect for her. She comes in rolling her bag behind her everyday overstuffed with work, and the bag has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: mysparklinglife

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as advertised and doesn't offer any protection
customer_reviews.text: It was too small to fit my 16.5" laptop, even "as is" and because it's so flimsy I would have wanted it to be big enough to fit the laptop while inside a padded sleeve. There's nothing between your laptop and things that might bump it, except the thin layer of canvas. And then there was certainly no room for a power cord, cables, mouse, etc. It might work for a tablet or smaller laptop which would have to be in some kind of case for protection.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me
customer_reviews.text: It is the right size to fit my needs. I carry my laptop, 2 notebooks, a few files, and two thick industry books. It goes from my house to my car to my office and back. I roll it on the pavement and it has held up well. I have not had to drag it up and down city streets. It is not fancy but it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Dickonson

customer_reviews.title: Small basic rolling bag.  No strap to attach to luggage.
customer_reviews.text: A fine bag if you don’t mind that it only rolls in one direction, has no strap to allow it to attach to other luggage and you have very little gear besides your laptop. I ended up returning it and got a larger Samsonite 4-wheel “spinner” with enough room for two laptops, chargers, mice, external battery, cables and some folders. Cost 4 times as much, so once again “you get what you pay for”
customer_reviews.author: Finn Markmanrud

customer_reviews.title: Well made laptop bag! Roomy and lots of pockets.
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag for work (as a teacher). My neck/shoulder was hurting from carrying my laptop and all the notebooks/school supplies that I haul around. I love that the front pocket is separate and has space for pens, pencils, chapstick and my keycard (which I was always misplacing). The inside has two separate compartments. One side has a padded laptop space. It’s pretty roomy and feels well made. The handle extends pretty high as well. I should bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wheels = Achilles heel
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this case for a year now, taken it on one round trip flight and used it about 25 times to carry my laptop and papers home from the office. There’s a lot I love about it. But today I discovered that the wheels are failing. One won’t spin at all, and the other is very slow to turn. And the kicker is that the wheels cannot be removed, fixed or replaced. So now I’m shopping for a laptop case again, just 11 months after buying this one. It stinks to send an otherwise fine piece of luggage into the landfill. Amazon: change the design so the wheels are replaceable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: LOOOOVE THIS! It’s very executive and doesn’t weigh much. It has 3 separate compartments. The front compartment is for pens, small papers or folders, the middle compartment is for the laptop. I also store ipad in this one, books and the computer charger. The third compartment is large and can fit boots, computer or camera equipment or even your lunch. One of my favorite purchases of 2018. Durable and doesn’t feel glimsy at sll.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, zipper seam pulled apart on first use, expect more from an Amazon backed product.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my new rolling bag this week for which I purchased for a work trip today. I’m at the airport today and feeling great about my new bag and how I feel the bag was a great value for the money. I unzip the bag to get my laptop at the gate to do some work and while zipping back up I see the seams pull apart. Picture attached. Very disappointed in the quality of an Amazon basics product. The seams break on the first use. Spend your money somewhere else if you want something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and functionality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has been a genuinely very good investment for me. for business owners it has a laptop compartment and has the ability to store multiple items. I think the durability might not be quite as good as a more expensive bag but for the price and value it is the best deal I could find. I would recommend this again
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Gor

customer_reviews.title: Very happy! Perfect size and easy to roll
customer_reviews.text: I travel between multiple work sites during the day and I was carrying everything I needed in a backpack. I've been having neck and shoulder issues so I bought this bag a little over a week ago. I'm in love with it. It is sturdy, easy to roll, holds everything I need, and it fits perfectly on the floor between driver's seat and backseat with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good bag.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good bag. Not great, but it’s good. The handle sticks a little and one side of it is a little loose, but that doesn’t impede use at all. The one thing I wish it had would be a key hook in the front pocket. I use the bag to hold my supplies for a class I teach and wish I had somewhere to put the key for our shared closet. We used it last weekend for a cross country airline flight and it held up well. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rosener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for School Bag
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of paying high prices for shoddy school book-bags that fell apart in a few months. This isn't 'cute' like the bright kids rolling book bags - but holds everything and has stood up to a full year of walking to school and back with lots of books. Not the standard use, but I'll order another if this wears out after another year.
customer_reviews.author: Gungo

customer_reviews.title: Really bad quality wheels
customer_reviews.text: The point of a roller case is to be able to pull it and not have to carry it. Well, in three weeks of use, the wheels became extremely worn, so much that the under side is being scraped by the floor. In THREE weeks of normal use. This is pathetic. This company needs to install higher quality wheels on these roller cases for them to be worth anything anyone wants to buy.
customer_reviews.author: MABeavO

customer_reviews.title: Really good product. Looks really good and professional
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. Looks really good and professional. I was slightly surprised at how small and lightweight it was out the box. But it holds A LOT. It's very sturdy. I have used it daily for a couple month, with my laptop, lots of reports, throw it in my trunk, up and down the stairs. And it looks brand new. I have a feeling that it will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: MiaNewbie

customer_reviews.title: For the price this isn't a bad bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for college to hold my books and my laptop so I don't have to carry a bag on my shoulders or a backpack. It has a lot of room, my laptop fits perfectly (Asus full size laptop) and has everything to keep my pens, folders, cc, debit cards and business cards organized. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: tbrackett

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but the wheels are to close so the bottom of the bag drags.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag but the wheels are inset, so the bottom of the bag drags a bit. I think this may be a problem soon as far as tears and rips at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Chery

customer_reviews.title: Great durable inexpensive case
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day of the work week and is rock solid. For the price this case is hard to beat. Nice roomy openings and rolls great. Double zippers on every opening. Computer pouch fits my 15" engineering laptop perfectly. I am almost 6' tall and the handle length is just right fully extended. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it so maybe the review is premature but....The bag looks nice. The interior capacity is good, plenty of room for a laptop and some notepads. My only complaint is that the handle for rolling seems awfully cheap. It is flimsy and twists a little side to side. I'm mostly using this bag for music books so weight isn't an issue but I'll be surprised if the handle holds up at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy R. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: If you do a lot of travel go with a better bag
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for not even 6 months and the handle has broken off of it. The little screws put in the handle cannot take the being used every day and they become weak over time. Once the screws weaken, you cannot tighten them back in. Believe me...I tried. The handle comes off of the bag rendering the rolling part useless. Otherwise, the material on the bag is quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dan DeFilippo

customer_reviews.title: I wish the wheels were more sturdy since the size is good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this - and for the price I guess it's okay, but if you are carrying some heavier things and want something to last this is not it. I carry 1 macbook air, 1 text book and two x 2" folders which is not an excessive amount of weight. The wheels have collapsed in just over 1 semester. I wish the wheels were more sturdy since the size is good. I now have to buy another one and will be looking at strong wheels as part of my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Camper Sam

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are atrocious!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR DAILY USE! If you use this occasionally for business trips, or once a week, perhaps it would be sufficient. However, after using it 4 days a week for my laptop and stenography equipment the wheels are shot! It lasted a total of 2 months. I was in a hurry and low on funds so I gave it a try, but now I'm paying for it. Going to splurge on a $100 bag which will most likely give more longevity. I wouldn't recommend, I'd save your money to spend on a product that will last long term.
customer_reviews.author: Emelia

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as wanted
customer_reviews.text: Gift for teenage granddaughter who hauls her laptop and associated electronic gear etc. around with her. Seems well made, looks great. She seems happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver, Travel Friendly!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would had this bag 6 months before I actually decided to buy it! I was doing a lot of traveling and when I finally decided to buy this bag, I wanted to kick myself for not buying it sooner! It has truly been a life-saver. Plenty of storage and easy to maneuver; one of my best purchases from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Burmesebabe

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say what a great little product for the price! Light weight, easy to carry, rolls nicely, plenty of room, plenty of pockets, I am so glad I was able to purchase this item for work. Fits my laptop computer and my documents nicely. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: D. Blair

customer_reviews.title: handle is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: the size of the bag and the material of the bag is great. The handle is NOT. It sticks when you try to extend it or to let it down. Is's extremely flimsy and I'm afraid this will not last the test of time and that the whole reason I bought this. Its a shame because it was a good price but they should have made the handle more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Blake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Meetings
customer_reviews.text: My wife has to take the laptop computer, etc from meeting to meeting and this rolling case is perfect for her needs. Pros: - Rolls easily - Lots of compartments - Computer compartment has a strap to keep the laptop firmly in place - Handle extension is very adequate and well made Cons: - The extending handle is zippered in a compartment and slightly more effort needed for use, but not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: T. Fowl

customer_reviews.title: Useful bag
customer_reviews.text: I have seen some bad reviews. I would say that if you are tough on a bag and are dragging along the city streets on a daily basis, then I would buy something more heavy duty. I use this bad 4x per month and I love it. It is lightweight and there is plenty of room for all my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Antoinette Perrie

customer_reviews.title: Good rolling bag, if it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Two and a half month later this very good rolling bag has failed - one wheel escaped the bag ! It's not really practical to repair it, but if the wheels are made better (sturdier), it would have been a very nice rolling bag. The ratings reflect my sincere disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Paula

customer_reviews.title: It’s a decent everyday laptop bag.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been banging this bag around for the last month or so and it has quite the capacity. It’s a little odd though because the inside seems like it’s smaller then it is. I think the laptop portion is a little funky because it hangs after a while, however, the durability of this case is fantastic. Dirt, concrete, gravel, it will travel wherever you roll it. The handle can be troublesome. It’s either fully extended or not. There’s no middle ground. The front pocket fits everything I could need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: No longer have to struggle with holding a purse, a laptop case, and my lunch. I actually use this to hold everything. Makes my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: TexasSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: I love this. I use it for work
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I use it for work. Very lightweight and has alot of pockets inside for your pens, pencils and whatever else you want to use them for. It has a separator in one of the pockets to put your lap top on one side and papers on the other side. In the second big pocket i put files in there. I read reviews on this before buying and I am happy i bought this. I didn't want to spend alot of money and this is perfect for what i need it for. You will be very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Penny McQ

customer_reviews.title: so this was perfect. Really hoping it holds up well with regular ...
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this bag so far. I use it everyday for work--I have enough space for my laptop and related accessories as well as my notebooks and documents. I was previously toting everything around in a large bag that was killing my shoulders and back, so this was perfect. Really hoping it holds up well with regular use. The handles and wheels on these types of bags seem to be the most common source of complaints, regardless of brand. The price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: seredaaddams

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when I have to go back and forth from home to office now that I work from home a lot. It has plenty of room for my laptop and all the folders/papers I need. Being able to roll it around is a plus because it gets heavy with everything I put in it. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It would be better if the wheels were a little bigger
customer_reviews.text: It would be better if the wheels were a little bigger. The bag is fine for rolling indoors on perfectly smooth floors, but it does not give enough clearance if you have to roll over anything of depth outdoors- for example, sidewalk lines not quite the same level. The underside edge of my bag was scuffed up the 1st day I used it because of this. Otherwise, the bag is great- good stability(doesn't fall over when you load it unevenly), very roomy, a good number of divider pockets, super lightweight... and of course, the awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Me 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I used this for college. I'm a commuter so I put my laptop, water bottle, notebooks, folders, snacks, etc... in there. I roll it around campus. Sometimes I have to carry it if there are stairs but it's not too heavy if it's only one flight of stairs. It's so much better than having to carry a backpack, especially since I have some injuries. It's definitely a conversation starter as almost everyone will comment on it. I guess it's because it looks like and sounds like I'm at an airport with a suitcase. It's also because I'm a student, rather than a professor, using it. Sadly, the wheels seemed to have reached their limit after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a Super Hero!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned, used, and abused this case for ovwr a year now and it is still going strong. I have drug it across gravel, grass, and sidewalks. I would definitely recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Some improvements would be great.
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't complain about this bag. But I do wish I'd just spent a little more and got one with a strap to hold it on top of my suitcase. But again - for the price - can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree

customer_reviews.title: good but needs to be made with better wheels and metal zippers, i would pay $30 more if it were......
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect rolling bag for me, i repair copiers and it fits everything i need. It is cheap, but durable, except for the wheels and zippers, but i have sewn on metal zippers on my new one and drilled out the rivets so i could put in roller blade wheels. this i my 3rd one so im going to make it last by upgrading the things that need it. It is the perfect size too, considering a tool bag like this costs $200......this lasts me 6 months of daily use of at least 1 mile of rolling...as long as the zippers don't break.
customer_reviews.author: amazonisshity

customer_reviews.title: Great case all around
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my back, as my work requires carrying lots of documents. Was using a shoulder bag, but would never go back after using this case. Laptop fits perfectly while in its sleeve. Great case all around. Highly recommend for replacement of a briefcase or work bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Rolling Bag Laptop Computer Case with Wheels
feature_bullets: Rolling laptop case designed for on-the-go professionals
Easy-access front pocket with compartments for smaller items like pens, notepads, and business cards
Designed to protect laptops with up to 15.6 inch screens
Adjustable push-button locking handle with quick-rolling wheels

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,422 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
